thread.title: AFP ready for rematch with film industry over incentives
thread.title_full: AFP ready for rematch with film industry over incentives

author: Frank Torres
title: AFP ready for rematch with film industry over incentives
text:
AFP ready for rematch with film industry over incentives October 8, 2015 Pinterest 0 
Americans for Prosperity announced this morning that they are ready for another showdown with the state’s entertainment industry over legislation that would provide incentives for media projects in the state’s such as film productions. 
“It’s not shocking to hear that special interests have their hands out again hoping to convince legislators to revive the failed film tax credit program,” said AFP state director, Chris Hudson . “AFP spent countless hours last session, knocked on thousands of doors, and made over 30,000 phone calls to Florida taxpayers to educate them about the failed track records of the film tax credit program, and the dismal 43 cents on the dollar return on investment; and we’re prepared to exorcise this demon again!” 
Advocates for the bill say it would bolster film programs at schools here in Central Florida like Full Sail and UCF and keep the talent they produce in state. They also believe they would grow jobs “behind the camera” that provide logistical support. 
Earlier this year, incentive bills sponsored by Republican lawmakers in the State House and Senate were bogged down during the fight over Medicaid expansion. AFP sent out “accountability mail” slamming lawmakers and advocates for the measure. Ultimately the group was very successful, defeating both the bills and the push for Medicaid expansion.
